Terrain::TerrainHeightMap2

Terrain::TerrainHeightMap2 Class Reference

This class provides access to terrain height map data for the second generation of terrain. More...

Classes

class  UnlockCallback

Detailed Description

This class provides access to terrain height map data for the second generation of terrain.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TerrainHeightMap2::TerrainHeightMap2 ( uint32  size = 0,
uint32  lodLevel = 0,
UnlockCallback *  unlockCallback = NULL 
) [explicit]

Construct a terrain height map.

Parameters:
size the width of the visible part of the height map.
visibleOffset the border of non-visible samples on each edge.
unlockCallback called when unlock() occurs.

bool TerrainHeightMap2::hmCollide ( WorldTriangle const &  triStart,
Vector3 const &  triEnd,
float  xStart,
float  zStart,
float  xEnd,
float  zEnd,
TerrainCollisionCallback *  pCallback 
) const

This function collides a prism with a rect in the heightmap.

Parameters:
triStart the start triangle of the prism
triEnd the end location of the prism
xStart the x start location of our rect
zStart the z start location of our rect
xEnd the x end location of our rect
zEnd the z end location of our rect
pCallback the collision callback
Returns:
true if collision should stop, false otherwise.

bool TerrainHeightMap2::hmCollide ( Vector3 const &  originalStart,
Vector3 const &  start,
Vector3 const &  end,
TerrainCollisionCallback *  pCallback 
) const

This function does line-segment intersection tests with the terrain using the height map values.

Parameters:
originalStart The source of the unclipped line-segment.
start The start of the line-segment.
end The end of the line-segment.
pCallback The terrain collision callback.
Returns:
true if collision should stop

TerrainHeightMap2::ImageType const & TerrainHeightMap2::image (  )  const [virtual]

This function accesses the TerrainMap as though it is an image.

This function can be called outside a lock/unlock pair.

Returns:
The TerrainMap as an image.

Implements Terrain::TerrainMap< float >.

bool TerrainHeightMap2::load ( DataSectionPtr  dataSection,
std::string *  error = NULL 
) [virtual]

This function loads the TerrainMap from a DataSection that was saved via TerrainMap::save.

You should not call this between lock/unlock pairs.

Parameters:
dataSection The DataSection to load from.
error If not NULL and an error occurs then this will be set to a reason why the error occurred.
Returns:
True if the load was successful.

Implements Terrain::TerrainMap< float >.
